author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Three’s a Charm
The rise in long-term Treasury bond yields to within reach of 3% for the first time in more than four years shows that robust global economic data are overcoming investor disquiet about the durability of the postcrisis recovery. Though analysts say the rising yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury significantly contributed to the 10% drop in the Dow industrials earlier this month—by upending favorable valuations based on lower rates—stocks have bounced back over the past week. This recovery reflects...
